problem.markdown:
>>Will doubling the length, modulus of elasticity, or moment of inertia have the largest effect on the amount of load that a column can support before buckling? << (x) length ( ) modulus of elasticity ( ) moment of inertia
[explanation] Explanation: modifying the length of the column will typically have the largest effect on the response. As an example, a column that is twice as tall will carry four times less load whereas a column with a modulus of elasticity that is twice as high will result in a column that is able to carry twice as much load. [explanation]
problem.p: Will doubling the length, modulus of elasticity, or moment of inertia have the largest effect on the amount of load that a column can support before buckling?

choicegroup.label: Will doubling the length, modulus of elasticity, or moment of inertia have the largest effect on the amount of load that a column can support before buckling?

div.p: Explanation: modifying the length of the column will typically have the largest effect on the response. As an example, a column that is twice as tall will carry four times less load whereas a column with a modulus of elasticity that is twice as high will result in a column that is able to carry twice as much load.
